com.metsci.glimpse.plot.timeline.event.listener

Class DragListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.metsci.glimpse.plot.timeline.event.listener.DragListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GlimpseMouseAllListener, GlimpseMouseListener, GlimpseMouseMotionListener, GlimpseMouseWheelListener, EventPlotListener

    public class DragListener
extends Object
implements EventPlotListener, GlimpseMouseAllListener
    Helper class which supports user dragging of Events to adjust their start/end times.
    Author:
    ulman

      • eventsHovered

        public void eventsHovered(GlimpseMouseEvent e,
                          Set<EventSelection> events,
                          TimeStamp time)
        Description copied from interface: EventPlotListener
        Indicates that the mouse moved while inside the Events contained in the EventSelection Set. EventSelection also provides information about what part of each Event the mouse is near (the start or end edge, the icon, the text label, etc...).
        Specified by:
        eventsHovered in interface EventPlotListener
        See Also:
        EventPlotListener.eventsExited(GlimpseMouseEvent, Set, TimeStamp)

      • eventsExited

        public void eventsExited(GlimpseMouseEvent e,
                         Set<EventSelection> events,
                         TimeStamp time)
        Description copied from interface: EventPlotListener
        Indicates the mouse moved outside of the events contained in the EventSelection Set.
        Specified by:
        eventsExited in interface EventPlotListener
        Parameters:
        e - the original MouseEvent which caused this eventsExited call
        events - the events which the mouse moved outside of
        time - the time corresponding to the mouse's current position

      • eventUpdated

        public void eventUpdated(GlimpseMouseEvent e,
                         Event event)
        Description copied from interface: EventPlotListener

        Indicates that the provided Event was updated by the user. If enabled, the user can click and drag to change the start and/or end time of Events. When the user does this, eventUpdated is called.

        If the update was caused by user mouse actions, the GlimpseMouseEvent argument will contain the mouse event which moved the event. If the event was modified programatically, then the GlimpseMouseEvent will be null.

        Specified by:
        eventUpdated in interface EventPlotListener
        Parameters:
        e - The GlimpseMouseEvent which caused the Event update, or null if the Event was updated programatically
        event - The updated Event
